turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nice place you got here.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Must get kind of lonely for a woman living by herself in a big house.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I guess it must.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What do you do anyway?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: A little of this, a little of that. Mostly I tell fortunes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where'd you learn to do that?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: From my father.  He was the tribe's Shaman.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: A medicine man?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Those are white words, not ours.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nice house for a Shaman's daughter. You must be good.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Come here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: My face tell you all that?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It tells me what every face tells me.  Everybody has a past, they have a pain, and they have something they want.  What is it you want?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The same thing you do.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There.  All done.  Lift me down.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Lift me down.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You can let go of me now.  I'm safe.  How do they look.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Like you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Beautiful?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Like they're made of polyester.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I like them.  I was sick of looking at this room.  I think they add a little life.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nothing like a little liveliness.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No more drapes to hang.  Now what should we do?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I have ideas.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: All right, Grace.  No more games.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Games?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You flirt with me, then you run cold.  You lead me on, then slap me down.  I don't go for being jerked around.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Really?  And what game did you want to play?  You carry my box for me, and I fall into bed with you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think I can find my own way back to into town.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe I like to find out about a man first.  Maybe I like to know what he's made of.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm just flesh and blood, baby. That and a few memories of bad women; just like most guys.  But you already know that.  You read my fortune.  Thanks for the lemonade.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You never did answer my question.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Still playing?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: That's not an answer.  What is it you want?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know what I want.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Maybe I just want to hear you say it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Damn it, Grace!  Tell him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: If he says that's what happened, Jake, it must be true.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Doesn't the heat bother you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, but I like the sun.  I grew up on a reservation.  The sun, the desert; they were like a religion to us.  Jake's the same way.  He loves the desert.  I guess we're alike that way.  That's about the only way.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You love him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Did you ever?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Depends on what you call love.  When I was growing up I had nothing.  I learned to want everything.  I wanted more than Sierra anyway. Jake was my ticket.  He's not much; he's older than me, different than me, but he's got more money than half this town put together.  I courted him.  I let him think he was courtin' me, but I reeled him in like a fish on a line.  I wanted him.  I wanted what he could give me, and I would've done anything to get him.  Is that love?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm guessing no.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, I guess you're right.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And I take it things didn't much work out the way you planned.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm still here, aren't I?  See this?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: All this nothing?  I've spent my life in this stinking desert.  It doesn't get to Jake like it got to me.  He doesn't mind being out here. He doesn't mind being nothing but a land broker.  Big fish in a small pond, he says.  More like a little fish in a dried up watering hole.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You could just leave him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't know how.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You just walk away.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's not that easy.  Maybe you can take chances; maybe you can wander around like some stray wherever you please.  I can't.  I don't want to be alone.  I need to know I'm going to be taken care of.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You need a meal ticket is what you mean.  Some guy you can latch onto just long enough for him to get you out of here.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is that so bad?  It's not like I wouldn't try to make him happy.  For awhile, anyway.  I mean, I would . . . do things for him.  I guess I'm no good that way.  I guess I tried to sucker you along like that.  Do you hate me for it?  I wouldn't blame you if you did.  But maybe it's like you said:  You just got to do whatever it takes to get out.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Whatever it takes.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: How far is it to California?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: From here?  I don't know.  Far.  Far enough.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Have you ever been there before?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is it pretty?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Beautiful.  Beautiful beaches.  Blue water and clear skies as far as you can see.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Take me with you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Please.  I won't hang on you.  As soon as we get there you can dump me.  I don't care.  I just want to get out of here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace, I can't.  I can't even get out of here myself.  I need a hundred-fifty bucks to get my car back from that crazy mechanic.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I know where we could get the money. A lot more than one-hundred-fifty dollars.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Jake.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You think Jake's going to give me money just so I can take you out of here?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He doesn't give it to us.  We take it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: From?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He's got money.  In a floor safe in the living room.  I've never seen it, but he talks about it all the time.  More like brags.  He loves his money.  Wouldn't think of spending some of it on me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You live pretty good.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, a bird in a gilded cage.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How much money has he got?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Near as I can figure must be about a hundred-thousand.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: One-hundred-thousand!?  That son-of- a-bitch lied to me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Lied?  What do you mean?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I . . . nothing.  Just something he said.  So if the money's in a safe we'd have to get the combination--

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's not a combination lock.  It takes a key.  He keeps it on him all the time.  I mean all the time.  It scratches up against me when we do it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: If the key's on him, to get the key we'd have to . . .

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: We'd have to kill him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John?  John where are you going?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think this heat is making me crazy.  I was crazy to come back here, I'm crazy for listening to anyone in this town, and I'd sure as hell be crazy if I spent another minute in this place.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John, please--

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know what I was thinking, but I can't do it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Kill someone.  I can't do it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is it so bad?  It would be quick. He wouldn't even have to feel it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's not like he's a young man. He's had time to live.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jesus Christ!  Listen to yourself! I can't do it, Grace.  I can't do it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I thought you would be on your way to Vegas by now.  Is there something you wanted?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I wanted to talk.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't think we have anything to talk about.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What about us?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There is no us, remember?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Except I can't get you out of my head, Grace.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I've thought about you every second since I left.  I can still taste you on my lips.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why?  Am I making you hot, or does the truth scare you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Because I know you're full of shit.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I mean it, Grace.  I'm getting out of here, and I want to take you with me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I thought you couldn't leave.  I thought you couldn't get your car.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I could if I had Jake's money.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is that what changed your mind?  The money?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't give a damn about the money. I want you, and I want to get us out of this shithole.  There's only one way to do that.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Are you sure?  About me, I mean?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I came back for you; this morning I came back.  Before I even knew about the money. You're what I want.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The only reason I stormed off is because you sort of spooked me talking about Jake.  But I've had nothing but time to think about it. It keeps coming back to you and me and us getting the hell out of here. But we've got to get the money, baby.  We get the money, I get the car, then we get the hell out.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You said you couldn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We don't have to kill him.  Just knock him out and tie him up 'till we get away.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace . . . Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: After dark.  I'll leave the back door unlocked.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why the hell didn't you do anything?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What was I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You could have hit him, or kneed him in the balls.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where's the safe?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't know?  Jesus Christ! Don't you think you should have found out before we killed him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm not sure where it is.  Not exactly.  I never saw it.  I just heard him talk about it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, that's great.  We killed Jake because you heard him talk about some money that you've never seen. That's fucking brilliant!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't yell at me!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nothing.  There's no safe under here.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There has to be!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: There isn't!  There's nothing under here but more floor.  Jesus fucking Christ!  We killed a man for nothing but floor.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's got to be here.  I heard him talk about it.  He bragged about it. Six steps out, three left.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: This is good.  This is real good. This is so good they might not even charge us with murder when they catch us.  They'll probably just lock us up for being idiots.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: If it isn't here, why would he wear that stupid key?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're calling Jake stupid?  You!?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't yell at me!  I know it's here! I know it!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: There's easily a hundred-thousand in there.  More than that.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I told you.  I knew it was there. Didn't I tell you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: If you want.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're going all the way.  Together.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Let's go in the bedroom.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Let's do it here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What about him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Let him watch.  I want him to know what he's missing.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You got a suitcase?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Never needed one.  I've never been anywhere.  I've got a backpack.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Get it, and put the money in it. Pack up anything else you want to take with you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: To get my car.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Wait.  What about . . . him?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Put some clothes on him.  When I get back We'll load him in the trunk and dump him in the desert.  It'll takes days for anybody to find him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John!?  What the hell's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I . . . nothing.  I just stubbed my toe on a rock.  Hurt like hell . . . that's all.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I got the money all packed.  I put the jeep in the garage.  Figure that way people will think maybe me and Jake went away.  Might buy us some time.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  Good thinking.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Had push it in.  Funny thing; it wouldn't start.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Funny thing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John . . .?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace!  Just . . . let me handle this.  Sheriff, I'm telling you there's nothing in that trunk.  If that's not good enough for you, then I'd be happy to open it.  Just as soon as you get yourself a search warrant.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Sheriff Potter, please.  I can't go to jail.  I wanted no part of it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You liar!  You wanted him dead.  You seduced me into killing him!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: One-hundred-thousand dollars.  A little more.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Damn you!  What did you do that for? He can't prove anything.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, you just wanted me to keep my mouth shut so I could go to a hanging alone.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: That's all talk.  He's got nothing on us.  He let you kill Jake.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Not me.  Us.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It doesn't matter.  He was there and he let it happen.  He can't take us in.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Give him the money.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You heard me.  Count it out.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He can't prove anything, John.  He can't turn us in.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: He can kill us.  I don't know about you, but my life is worth thirty- thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I shot him.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You killed him!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He was going to take the money.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Thirty-thousand, that's all.  We would have been free and clear.  You didn't have to kill him.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's our money.  He had no right to take it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're crazy, you know that!? You're fucked up!?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Just drive.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jesus, Grace.  Did you have to kill him?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He was going to--

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know.  He was to take the fucking money.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're tense.  What are you all uptight about?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You killed a man for no reason!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is that the kind of girl you think I am?  What can I do to make you relax?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You could give me the gun.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, nothing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Now we dump Jake, split the money, then you're on your own.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: But you said we could be together.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Are you kidding?  I'm not going down with you for killing a cop.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What difference does it make?  You killed Jake.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: <u>We</u> killed Jake.  And it's a big difference.  You kill an old man, that's one thing.  Nobody cares about an old man.  You kill a cop and they never stop looking for you. Never.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He was a crooked bastard.  He would have killed us.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The police don't know that.  And it's going to be hard to explain it to them with a noose around your neck.  I'll take you as far as California.  If we can even make that.  After that I'm cutting you loose.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: But I want to say with you,

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why?  So when the cops catch up with us you can try and sell me out again?  You take your hald of the money and run.  You might want to try Mexico.  With all that dough you'll live like a queen.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't want to go to Mexico, John. I want to be with you.  Don't you think I care about you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think you're a lying, back stabbing bitch.  But it's nice to know you care.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I think I busted my leg.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Can you climb back up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I can't make it.  Grace?  Grace!?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace, listen to me.  In the trunk of my car is a rope.  It should reach down here.  Got get it, throw it down and I'll climb up.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'll get it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John!  Can you hear me?  Are you still there?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where the hell am I going to go?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John, you have to throw the keys up to me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John, throw me the keys.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: The trunk.  It's locked.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's not locked.  I left it open when I took out Jake's body.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's . . . it's locked.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You closed it, didn't you, Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I was going to back the car to the ridge and pull you up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Bullshit, Grace.  You were going to drive off and leave me here.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No.  I swear it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And you're not one to lie, are you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Throw me the keys and I'll pull you up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why don't you come down and get them so I can wring your pretty little neck?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: John, if you don't throw me the keys, then I'll just walk away. Walk away and leave you here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Walk to where?  We're fifty miles to the nearest town.  It's going to be over one-hundred degrees today.  How far do you think you're going to get?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Someone will find me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, they'll find you.  Dried up and twice dead.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You idiot!  You'll kill us both!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: At least I'll have company when I die.  Ain't that right, Jake?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: For Christ's sake, John!  Throw me the keys!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What do you say, Jake?  Should we trust her?  No?  I didn't think so.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Fuck you!  Do you hear me, John!? Fuck you!  John . . . John!?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm her husband.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Husband . . .?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Now who the hell are you, and it better be good, or God help me I'll break you in half.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I . . I was helping your wife.  I met her in town.  She needed a hand with her drapes.  That's all.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Didn't much look like you were hanging drapes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I swear to you that's all that happened.  I haven't so much as set foot in your bedroom.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A lot that means.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Grace, tell him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I have half a mind to--

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is this what it's all about?  You sucker me up here so you can watch the two of us beat the shit out of each other over you?  Forget it.  You want to take my head off, Mister, I won't even try to stop you.  I deserve it for being an idiot.  But if you're not, I think I'll be on my way.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What happened to your hand?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Accident.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You've got to be--

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  More careful.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I guess we've never been introduced proper.  Jake McKenna.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jake McKenna.  That's a solid name.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm a solid man.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: John Stewart.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What brings you to Sierra?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: My car overheated.  I pulled in to have it fixed.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where you headed?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I've got to make a stop in Vegas, then I'm heading to Santa Barbara.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Live there?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Got work.  I know a man who's got a boat.  Wants me to sail it for him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You a sailor man?  That'd be the life.  Drive across the country, step on a boat and just sail away. A man could pretty well disappear like that.  Just sail away until all he was was a memory.  I guess a little place like this would just be a dot on a map to you after awhile.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I hope so.  Listen, Mr. McKenna, about your wife:  If I had known she was married--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It wouldn't have made a difference to you, now would it?  Not a wit. Do you know why?  Because you're a man without scruples.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wait a second--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ah, I can smell it on you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's the sweat of a man who hasn't an honest bone in his body.  Don't be offended, lad.  A man who's got no ethics is a free man.  I envy you that.  Beside, I can hardly blame you.  That Grace has a mind of her own, and a body to match, don't she? Eh?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She does at that.  I knew when I married her she was a free spirit. A woman with her looks and a man my age; what was I to expect?  But you see a woman like that in a town like this and you don't think, you do. So, I married her.  What are you to do, eh?  Women.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Can't live with them, and you can't shoot 'em.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I bet she led you on good, didn't she?  Taking you up to the house with that smile of hers.  Bet she wiggled her ass in your face more than once.  Then me busting in like some wild bear.  Bet you had a fire going under you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Like you don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Mad like a dog in heat, I bet you were.  I can tell you got a temper on you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Would you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Would I what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Would you kill her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Why would I kill her?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Because I'm sick and tired of her little games.  Because you could do it and drift away on your boat and no one would ever see you again. Because I've got a fifty-thousand dollar life insurance policy on her, and I would be more than happy to give the man who does her in a good chunk of it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not a murderer, Mr. McKenna.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How do you know if you've never tried?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: This is a joke, right?  You just want to rattle me.  Right?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Good Lord.  What happened to you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Just ran into a little trouble.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Another accident?  You've really got to be more careful.  Can I get you a drink?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hungry?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm surprised to see you.  I thought you'd be halfway to Vegas by now.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I had a problem getting my car back.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You just seem to attract trouble, don't you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nice office you've got.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I do all right.  Real estate isn't a bad game such as it is around here. The trick is to underestimate the price when you buy it, and overvalue when you sell.  You can turn a few dollars that way.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Isn't that illegal?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Now what can I do for you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I was hoping we could talk.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Talk?  About what?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: About things.  About your wife.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sweet Grace?  What about her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: About what you said this morning.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You said you had an insurance policy out on your wife.  Fifty-thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You said you'd cut that up with the man who did her in.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Don't play simple with me, Jake. You want me to spell it out for you? I'll kill Grace if you cut me in on the money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I think this heat's getting to you the way you're rambling on.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not rambling.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're talking like a mad man.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're the one who brought it up. This morning.  In your car.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That was just loose talk.  I don't want anybody dead.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Bullshit.  You wanted me to kill her.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A man doesn't always mean the things he says.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You meant it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Because I think you're a slimy bastard who would have his wife killed just to get his hands on some money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And what does that make you?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The slimy bastard who's going to do it for you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Let's say I do want her dead.  What is it you want?  This morning you weren't a killer.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: This morning I didn't know how badly I'd want to get out of this fucking town.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And for that you'd kill Grace?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: For that I'd kill a nun on Easter Sunday.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just to get out of here?  That doesn't seem much for a murder.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How do you put a price on murder?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I put it at fifty-thousand dollars, minus your cut, of course.  Which is?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Make it twenty.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Twenty-thousand?  I don't have that kind of money.  I won't get the insurance until months after she's dead.  I don't imagine you'll want to be around after poor Grace's demise.  Twenty-thousand; that's more money than I could ever get my hands on.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How much could you get?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Maybe . . . ten-thousand.  And that's a maybe.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I need thirteen.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's a bit much.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're not buying a car, for Christ sake.  You're having your wife killed.  I'm the one who's neck is stuck out.  It's thirteen, or it's nothing.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You drive a hard bargain, but I had a feeling you were my boy when I met you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not your boy, Jake.  I don't like you, and I don't like what you are.  I got no choice but to do business with you.  This is just a nasty little marriage of convenience.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't say that.  I had a marriage of convenience with Grace, and look where that's lead.  Well, looks like we got ourselves a pact.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Do we shake hands?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: If you can't trust the man you've hired to kill your wife . . .?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I guess I might as well get this done with.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: The sooner it's over, the sooner you're on your way.  Now listen to me:  It's got to look like an accident; that's the thing.  If it doesn't, then it's no good.  I won't get a dime, and it's my neck that'll be on the chopping block while you're living it up somewhere.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What should I do?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How the hell should I know?  I've never had a wife killed before.  I guess I should have hired a professional.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You want to do this yourself?  I don't have to do this, you know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Be quiet, boy.  I'm thinking.  It can't be done at the house.  It should be . . .

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This is what you do:  Go to the house to see her.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And tell her what?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I went to your place.  We talked, just like you told me.  We drove out into the desert . . .

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Is the job done?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You didn't kill her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: The time wasn't right.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're out in the desert, the middle of nowhere with no one around for miles, and you say the time wasn't right?  What's the matter?  You were hoping to get it on home video?  A keepsake for the grandkids.  Thank God I waited, or I never would have gotten it on tape.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I know all right.  I know you're just enough of a shit to have a go at bedding a man's wife.  You've probably bagged a few at that. You'd probably lie, cheat and steal without thinking twice.  From that you'd just turn and walk away.  But to kill; to get that blood on your hands.  You can't wash that off. You'd be a marked man for life. Just like Cain.  And you're a sinner who wants to walk with the saints. Ain't that right, boy?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know so much about killing why don't you do it yourself?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I guess I have what you'd call a love-hate relationship with Grace.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You love her, but you hate her?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I hate loving her.  I hate the kind of her person she is.  I hate having to tolerate the little games she plays.  I hate letting her use me. But I love her too much to do otherwise.  And I certainly love her too much to kill her.  I couldn't stand to watch her eyes roll back in her head as she sucks her last breath, or to see her pretty pink brains spill from her skull.  But you?  You got the killing in you, boy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Came close this time and it scares you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Drop it, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And next time, next time somebody is going to get dead.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jake, how much were you going to pay me to do the job?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Thirteen-thousand dollars.  Had you done it.  Isn't that what we agreed on?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You think that's a lot of money?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: All I have in the world.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's what I like about you, Jake. You're an honest man.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Maybe not this time, but somebody's going to get dead around you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, well, me too.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Trouble with the car again?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You could say.  I don't even have it yet.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Darrell giving you problems?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: He did more work on the car.  He wants fifty bucks extra for it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Fifty dollars more.  That's a lot of money when you don't have a dime. And where'd you plan on getting the money from?  Maybe you thought you'd pay your friend Jake McKenna a visit.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's not like that.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Maybe you heard old Jake's got some money stashed away and you thought you'd help yourself to a little.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Just listen to me--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You thought you'd come in here in the middle of the night and wham! Wail off and clock old Jake McKenna and turn his brains into wall paper.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jake--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And then with Jake out of the way you could borrow two-hundred dollars.  Or maybe two-thousand.  Or twenty-thousand.  Who's to stop you? Not Jake McKenna, 'cause old Jake would be dead.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's not the reason I'm here.  I swear it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There's another reason?  It better be good.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I came for Grace.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You came to take my wife from me?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I came to kill her.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Liar.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's the truth, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's a thick change of heart.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, well, a couple of hours ago I just about killed some guy over a girl.  Not for money, for a girl. And she was just going to stand there and let it happen, or let him kill me.  Same way Grace played us this morning.  I don't like that, Jake.  Not twice in one day.  And maybe I'm so pissed I'd twist the next off my own Grandma to get out of here.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's a lot of talk.  A whole lot of talk.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Damn it, Jake.  If I don't get out of here some guys are going to come gunning for me.  And if it comes down to me or Grace, then I pick Grace.  You were going to give me thirteen-thousand.  Give me two- hundred.  I'll kill her and dump the body where no one will ever find it. But I need the money.  I've got to have the money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm curious about something.  I'm wondering just how it is you happen to know where the bedroom's at.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wh . . . what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This morning when I came in on you and Grace, you swore you hadn't so much as been near the bedroom.  Now you make straight for it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Come on, Jake--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't Jake me, boy!  It's a big house.  Odd that you would know your way, except maybe you've been in the bedroom before.  Maybe with Grace to keep you company.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nothing happened with me and Grace this morning.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Then maybe this afternoon.  When I sent you to kill my wife you ended up sexing her instead.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Christ, Jake, please--

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Is that what happened?  Did you even make it out to the desert, or did you just ply the afternoon between my sheets?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're not talking sense.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sense?  If I had any sense I would have killed you this morning and been done with it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What are you . . . you can't . . . you can't kill me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A drifter, a loner, a trouble maker like you?  Just passing through town, need money so he busts in on an, old man.  Only this old man's got himself an automatic, and he knows how to use it.  A man's got to protect his home.  His wife.  You're dead, boy, and your own mother wouldn't convict me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What difference does it make if I slept with her.  You don't care about Grace.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're right.  I don't give a damn about her.  But to fuck a man's wife behind his back?  That just makes a fool out of him.  I don't like being made a fool of.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't blame you.  What man would? I admit it, okay?  I came back here and I made it with Grace.  But if you kill me you're making a big mistake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Not from where I stand.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's not me you have to worry about. It's her.  She wants you dead, Jake. She wants you dead and she wants your money.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What are you babbling about?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Think about it.  How do you think I got in here?  Did you hear any glass break?  Did you hear a door splinter?  How did the evening end? After you went to bed did she linger a bit?  Maybe just long enough to leave the back door unlocked?  Is that what happened?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You'd tell me anything to save your pathetic life.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know what kind of woman Grace is.  You know how badly she wants to get the fuck out of Sierra.  What makes you think when you were planning on killing her she wasn't doing the same for you?  What's she to you, Jake; a woman who would have you dead?  Let me kill her.  All I want is two-hundred dollars to get out of here with.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Two-hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Two-hundred dollars . . . that's how I put a price on murder.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I asked you a question.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Aw, Toby, we weren't doing nothing. We was just talking.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You shut your mouth, girl, and get back over to our table.  Now, I'm not going to ask you again, Mister.  What were you doing with my girl?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Honest, Toby.  I just asked him for a quarter for the jukebox.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stay out of this, Jenny.  We got man's business to take care of.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I want to stay.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I said come on!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Toby!  Toby Tyler, leave him alone!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You stay away, Jenny.  I aim to mess him up, and that ain't a thing for a woman to see.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Hey, Mister.  You gotta quarter?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I wanna play a song on the juke. You got a quarter?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What happened to your hand?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Accident, and yeah, I got to be more careful.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Got any requests?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That country shit all sounds the same to me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: How about I pick one out for you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You like Patsy Cline?  I just love her.  How come, I wonder, she don't put out no more new records.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: She's dead.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Gee, that's sad.  Don't that make you sad?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I've had time to get over it.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You're not from around here, are you?  Where you from?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oz.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You ain't from Oz.  Oz is in that one movie.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're too quick for me.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Hey, Mister.  Mister.  I just. . . I just wanted to thank you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: For defending my honor this afternoon.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I hate to bust your bubble, but I wasn't defending you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: But you was going to fight for me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I wasn't going to fight for you.  I was just going to beat the shit out of your boyfriend.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: He's not my boyfriend.  I mean, I let him take me out and stuff, but I ain't spoken for.  Not yet that is.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Get it through your head, little girl; I'm not going for you.  If this Toby likes you, then if I were you I'd marry him.  You're not going to get much better in this town.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: That's what I thought until you came riding in.  I saw your car over at the gas station.  It's cool.  Want to take me for a ride?  Desert's kind of lonely this time of day.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Eighteen.  Well, I'm gonna be eighteen in two years, but that don't mean you can't take me for a ride if you want.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, I don't want to take you for a ride.  What I want is for . . . Hey, you don't happen to have a hundred and fifty dollars I could--

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You're too late, Toby.  We're going to get in his fancy car and ride off and leave you behind.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What's your name anyway?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Toby Tyler, it don't matter to me if you beat him all up and knock out all his teeth and he's just drooling and bleeding all over hisself, 'cause we love each other and we gonna run off, and I'm gonna have his love child.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Will you shut up!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Don't be afraid of him none.  I don't care what he does to you, we can still be together.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Get away from me!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I wasn't doing anything.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That's not the way it looked to me. Looked to me like you was trying to make time with her.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Make time?  Is everybody in this town slap happy?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Look, pal, I wasn't making a play for your girl.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You expect me to believe that?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't care what you believe as long as you leave me alone.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mister, I'm calling you out.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?  You want to fight?  Over her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're fucked.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You know who I am?  Toby N. Tyler. My friends call me TNT. You know why?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: They're not very imaginative?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: 'Cause I'm just like dynamite.  And when I go off somebody gets hurt.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Fine.  I was making time with your girl.  Now I'm all scared, and I'll never make that mistake again.  Now go away.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Not before I settle with you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Christ, I don't believe this.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stand up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I wasn't hitting on your girl!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stand up, Mister, or I'll beat you where you sit.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mister!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, shit!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: That's right, Mister.  You better be afraid.  I told you it wasn't over, but you didn't listen.  Now I find you sneakin' around with my girl behind my back.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I wasn't sneaking around with your girl.  Would you please tell him?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Oh, that tears it, Mister.  I'm gonna bust you up but good.  I'm gonna bust you into a million pieces and then . . . and then bust those pieces up, and then . . . and then spread them all around.  That's what I'm gonna do.  You don't know what you're dealing with, Mister.  I'm crazy.  I'm psycho crazy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  You're TNT.  Just like dynamite.  When you go off somebody gets hurt.  All right.  Let's do this.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Get up, Mister!  Don't ever let it be said Toby Tyler beat the living shit out of someone without giving them a fair chance.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?  Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I'm doing what any man would do if he'd been offended.  I'm beating you up.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You stupid punk!  You don't even know what you're fighting over!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: My honor, that's what I'm fighting over.  Now get up off the ground, or do I have to whoop you where you lie?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Now, what's this?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Give it to me!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Mexico?  You're going to Mexico?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm leaving.  You never have to see me again.  Just please, give me the ticket!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: This means something to you?  Jenny means something to me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nooo!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I'm gonna beat you so bad you gonna be eatin' nothing but soup the rest of your days.  Rain dogs is gonna be prettier than you when I'm done. I'm gonna mess you up so bad you gonna make your own momma sick.  I'm gonna . . .

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: John, what a surprise.  I expected to be seeing you, not talking to you over the phone.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know, Mr. Vesci.  I know.  I was on my way to you, it's just . . . what a day I've had.  You're not going to believe what's happened to me. I had the money, I swear I had it. I was on my way to you when my car breaks down in the middle of nowhere.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: That's a shame, John.  A real shame.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't know the how, Mr. Vesci. And that's not the half of it.  I've got your money, and I go into this little grocery store to get something to eat and it gets robbed.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: Let me guess.  This robber; he gets your money.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No.  He gets shot by the old lady.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: The old lady?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: With a shotgun.  It kills him, and it shreads the money.  I mean, what are the odds?

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: You're the gambler.  You tell me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I had to beat it before the cops showed up.  I don't have a cent to my name.  I can't even get my car out of the garage.  I tell you, Mr. Vesci, if it weren't for bad luck I wouldn't have any at all.  So, I was wondering if you could wire me a hundred fifty-dollars so I could get my car.  I'll pay it back with the rest of the money.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: Let me get this straight:  You owe me thirteen-thousand dollars, you call me - collect - then ask me to wire you one-hundred-fifty dollars just so you can get your car fixed.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: A hundred-forty-five really.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: A hundred and . . . Now you listen to me you deadbeat, little punk:  I don't care if you got hit by a truck and run over by a steamroller.  You owe me thirteen-thousand dollars and I want it.  I don't care how you get it, or where from, but I want it on my desk tomorrow, or I'll show you what real bad luck is.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: Do you understand me you little fuck?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Vesci.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: And John, don't make me come look for you.

turns.speaker: MR. VESCI
turns.text: Fucking kid.  And look at you; breaking fucking pencils.  You're a Neanderthal.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hello?  Hello!?  Operator, I got disconnected.  Hello . . .

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Kids.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  What are you going to do? That Toby's a hot head.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: He is at that.  No so much a fault of his own.  Poor boy had quite a trauma as a child.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: His father worked in a strip mine north of here.  Toby's school class went up to the mine one day.  School takes field trips up there every year.  Big day for the kids when they can see ore tore up out of the ground.  Anyway, on this particular day Toby's dad up and falls into the machinery.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Yep.  Tore him up good and spat out little, refined pieces of him. Nothing like the embarrassment of having your father refined in front of your classmates to put the anger in a young man.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Like I said; you really can't blame the boy.  Some people don't know how to avoid trouble.  Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Saw you at the truck stop this morning.  You're not from around here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, sir.  And I'm not going to be around long if that's what you're worried about.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Just curious.  That's a nasty cut you've got.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Not as bad as it looks.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: There was a young man over at Jamilla's today when it got hit. Way she tells it he got whacked around by one of the robbers.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wouldn't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: That's too bad.  I was hoping you were there.  Maybe you could help us catch the guy who got away.  Or maybe you could explain about all that money that got tore up when Jamilla shot that biker.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wish I could help, Sheriff.  But if you'll excuse me I'm going over to Harlin's to pick up my car.  Then I'm getting the hell out of this place.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Stay as long as you like, son.  No rush.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Maybe not for you, Sheriff, but I think I've had my fill of your little town.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Nice night for a drive.  Morning really.  I guess that's about the only way to keep cool; riding around with the top down on a fancy convertible in the first hours of the day.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Not taking a drive, Sheriff. Heading out of town.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Suppose you've had all you can of Sierra.  What with that ruckus you had with Toby.  Oh yes, I heard all about that.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sheriff, he didn't give me any choice.  If I hadn't defended myself- -

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Just cool down, son.  I ain't accusing you of anything.  Serves Toby right to get his ass whooped. If you hadn't done it, somebody else would've.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is there a problem up the road, Sheriff?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Nope.  No problems up the road.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Why don't you step out of the car, son?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't understand what the--

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Just step from the car.  Nice and slow.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sure, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Now step around to the back of the car and open the trunk for me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I think you might just want to do as I say.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: There's nothing in the trunk, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: And as soon as I see that you're on your way.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You bitch!  You were in on it froom the start!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Shut up!  The both of you.  Ain't neither one of you too smart. Especially you, boy.  Don't you think I had my eye on you since first you rolled into town?  You smell like trouble.  Stink of it like a ripe cesspool.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I didn't do anything.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Killing Jake McKenna's got to amount to something.  He wasn't much of a man, but that don't give you the right to murder him.  And don't tell me you didn't, 'cause I know you did.  I was there.  Like I said; I been watching you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's what this is all about?  A shakedown?  You picked the wrong people.  We don't have any money.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Sure you do.  Everybody in town knows about the money Jake kept hid in the house.  It's a wonder the Mrs. here just now got round to killing him.  Not for lack of trying.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What'd you think, boy?  That you were the first man to drift through this town she came on to?  Not by a long shot.  You're just the most gullible.  How much did you get?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Thirty-thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You ain't passing these test, son. If I can't trust you I'm gonna have to arrest you . . .

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Nobody's going to hang.  We're all gonna walk away with a little something.  I ain't a greedy man. And, hell, you did all the work. One-hundred-thousand dollars.  Split that three ways and it comes out to about thirty-three thousand.  Give or take.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And you're taking?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Got any cold soda?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Eh?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Soda.  You got any soda?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Hablar slowly, por favor.  My ingles no es bien.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Soda.  You know.
